title: Disciple
fluff: From the depths of forgotten and unknowable realms, the Drow Divine weave a strange and chaotic magic, a power granted to them by their wicked lords and gods. Icy cold and fiercely passionate, these enigmatic beings adhere to ancient and twisted rites, bonding their faithless hearts with the tenets of a cruel deity — one whose spite is ever present, ready to transform their dangerous magic from a blessing to a curse in a moment's notice.
weapons: Club, crossbow, dagger, mace, longbow, longsword, shortbow, shortsword

specialTalents.name: Languages.
specialTalents.description: You know either Diabolic or Primordial.

specialTalents.name: Spider Affinity.
specialTalents.description: Drow live alongside many different species of spiders, including giant ones. You can speak the secret language of spiders and gain a +1 bonus to reaction rolls when encountering spiders.

specialTalents.name: Deity.
specialTalents.description: Choose a chaotic god to serve (see Deities). You have a holy symbol for your god (it takes up no gear slots).

talents.talent: Learn one additional spell of any tier you know
+2 to Dexterity or +1 to spellcasting checks
Gain advantage on casting one spell you know
Choose a talent or +2 points to distribute to ability scores

reward.name: Fane.
reward.value: Upon reaching the title of Patriarch/Matriarch you may establish or build a Fane. When the construction is complete, a number of followers will arrive to serve.

description.name: Spellcasting.
description.description: You can cast Drow Divine spells you know. You know two tier 1 spells of your choice from the Drow Divine spell list. Each time you gain a level, you choose new spells to learn according to the Spells Known table.

spellTalents.name: Divine Blessing.
spellTalents.description: You know the web spell. It doesn't count toward your number of known spells.

description.name: Disfavour Rate.
description.value: Disfavour rate of the drow divine starts at 1 and increases by one every time you fail your spellcasting check. If the natural number on the die of the spellcasting check falls into the Disfavour Rate, the spell check automatically fails, and you must roll on the Diety's Spite table. When the you regain spells on the following day, your disfavour range is reset to a 1. Probably.

description.name: Sacrifices.
description.value: Once your range of disfavour increases beyond a natural 1, you can reduce that range by offering sacrifices to your deity.

description.name: Blood Sacrifice.
description.value: If your last action before spellcasting was inflicting damage in close range, you can lower Disfavour Rate by this damage amount. Disfavour Rate, however, can't be lower than 1. You can choose to inflict damage on yourself or any willing target. In that case, the amount of damage can be chosen as any number from their weapon dice.

description.name: Sins.
description.value: When a you commit a sinful act, you may incur an additional increase in your disfavour range. This could amount to an increase of +1 for minor infractions all the way up to +10 for significant transgressions.

description.name: Diety's Spite roll.
description.value: The roll is 2d6 + double spell tier.
